title: Ransomware Attack Simulation
description: A comprehensive ransomware attack scenario that tests incident response capabilities across technical, legal, communication, and executive decision-making domains.

injects.content: URGENT: Multiple workstations reporting encrypted files. Users unable to access documents, databases, and shared drives. Initial reports suggest ransomware activity.
SIEM Alert: Suspicious network activity detected. Multiple failed login attempts from external IP {{EXTERNAL_IP}} targeting domain controllers. Lateral movement indicators present.

required_actions.action: Preserve evidence and create forensic images

injects.content: Ransom Note Discovered: 'Your files have been encrypted. To recover your data, pay {{RANSOM_AMOUNT}} in Bitcoin within 72 hours. Contact: {{RANSOM_EMAIL}}'

required_actions.action: Review legal implications and notify law enforcement
Document ransom demand and preserve evidence

injects.content: Media Inquiry: Local news outlet is asking about reports of a cyber attack affecting {{ORG_NAME}}. They have received anonymous tips about data encryption and ransom demands.

required_actions.action: Prepare public statement and media response
Approve communication strategy and legal review

injects.content: Critical Alert: Backup systems compromised. Last known good backup from {{BACKUP_DATE}}. Recovery time estimated at {{RECOVERY_HOURS}} hours for full restoration.

required_actions.action: Verify backup integrity and test restoration

injects.content: Regulatory Notification Required: Based on initial assessment, this incident may require notification to {{REGULATORY_BODY}} within {{NOTIFICATION_HOURS}} hours due to potential data exposure.

required_actions.action: Prepare regulatory notification and assess compliance requirements

injects.content: Executive Decision Point: The ransomware group has increased their demands and threatened to leak sensitive data publicly. They are offering a 24-hour extension for payment. How do you proceed?

required_actions.action: Make final decision on ransom payment and data leak response

metadata.author: ThreatRecon Team
metadata.facilitator_notes: This scenario tests comprehensive incident response capabilities. Focus on decision-making under pressure, communication effectiveness, and legal compliance. The branching logic allows for different outcomes based on ransom payment decisions.
